name: df-mnd
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cmnd, crab(s0, csgrp, wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wrex(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cv(s1), wa(wceq(co(cv(s3), cv(s2), cv(s4)), cv(s4)), wceq(co(cv(s4), cv(s2), cv(s3)), cv(s4)))))))))
comment: A _monoid_ is a semigroup, which has a two-sided neutral element. Definition 2 in [BourbakiAlg1] p. 12. In other words (according to the definition in [Lang] p. 3), a monoid is a set equipped with an everywhere defined internal operation (see ~ mndcl ), whose operation is associative (see ~ mndass ) and has a two-sided neutral element (see ~ mndid ), see also ~ ismnd . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 1-Feb-2020.)
